attributes.action: ...abolish the Royal prerogative and clearly define the Crown's powers in terms of statute law
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
1. The Royal prerogative is the remainder of common law (non-statutory) power left in the Government's hands, exercisable by The Queen with the Prime Minister's advice or by the Government on behalf of The Queen.

2. The Royal prerogative includes the powers, without recourse to Parliament, to deploy troops and declare a state of war, to make treaties which override British law and to otherwise behave in a manner not authorised by statute law but vaguely authorised by common law developed centuries ago.

3. ENACT legislation (a) clearly defining what powers the Government has and does not have, (b) giving Parliament alone the power to declare war and deploy troops, (c) giving Parliament a vote on all treaties, and (d) clearly defining The Queen's discretionary powers.
